channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over grown tree, 13th June
item.description:
Neighbours tree is in encroaching to my side / dropping branches leafs bug and moving in bad weather. We can not allow my kids in the garden know more due to under line health conditions. My son has just had a major head surgery and if anything hit this we are back to the hospital and branches have fallen . My daughter is allergic to pollen so bad that she needs antihistamines Twice a day every day and tree pollen drops tree sap all over the toys so now she can not go in the garden . My youngest daughter had found a number of bugs see attached photo . I can send in documents off illness of the kids to prove this needs doing as if this hits the boy or daughter had a reaction both need to go to hospital and this is a problem I don’t want Lewisham don’t want . Council bin lorry’s hit this when going around the back to bin collect as this is going in the round . This is a health and safety issue as if this goes over or hits someone Address of the tree is 46 castleton road Resident can not control this and don’t go in there own garden so they don’t care

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castleton Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing public footpath sign., 13th June
item.description:
This entrance can found in Old Road between house numbers 6 and 7 on Old Road by following the footpath between those two houses but there is no public footpath sign. https://www.theundergroundmap.com/article.html?id=3720
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Old Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loud roadworks at 2am, 13th June
item.description:
These roadworks on Walworth Road have been going on all night, they are extremely loud and make it almost impossible to sleep. Regardless of how busy Walworth Road is during the day, there is no way this level of disruption to local residents’ sleep is a better option than diverting some of the traffic. Please consider working during non-peak daytime hours or even in the early evenings, instead of starting at 10pm and going on through the night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

From the garage

item.title: Nightly bonfire after 11pm burning waste, 13th June
item.description:
Every night the last 4 weeks, tenants at 143 Rendlesham Road, E5 8PA light a large bonfire in their garden burning building waste after 11pm, burns for hours, creating large amounts of smoke, and sparks flying over their fence. We can’t have windows open.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rendlesham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in the bin for a week, 13th June
item.description:
Someone reported a dead fox last week Saturday, outside number 7. it has been in the bin since, its smelling the whole street with a terrible smell, and there are loads of flies around it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Rain shelter needed, 12th June
item.description:
This is the biggest bus-stop for thousands of passengers a day 24/7 - with more than 20 bus-routes. Please create some rain/wind shelter and seating. Most passengers are not rich, old, working hard in key sectors for society -so please help all of them to make their journeys better.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 114, Walworth Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear Hackney Council can you please address these issues that are taken place all across the borough of hackney there is an increase of high numbers of members of public smoking marijuana,cannabis in public,public spaces,public parks, Hackney Council estates and buildings. There is no authority enforcing this behavior or metropolitan police. It is like a lawless Britain.What action is Hackney Council doing across the borough of Hackney to tackle these issues allowing this illegal activity to take place all over the borough. Corruption or funding issues. Could you please abbreviate on your policies., 12th June
item.description:
Dear Hackney Council can you please address these issues that are taken place all across the borough of hackney there is an increase of high numbers of members of public smoking marijuana cannabis in public,public spaces,public parks, Council estates ASB

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillman Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 1 Arco Walk, on College Lane, 12th June
item.description:
There is a paving tile/ slab missing and therefore a major falling hazard and I fell myself , twisting my ankle horribly so that I was unable to go to work for one week. I have seen many others fall there as it is right outside our house and needs to be fixed with urgency please. It will be HUGELY appreciated and we will be massively grateful even if a temporary solution can be found .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Lane, Dartmouth Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
